intro: Erigeron vidalii, commonly known as the Vidal's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron vidalii is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
